Key:
(We escaped from the collapsing Neo Tengu Tower,
and when we came to, we were at Takadai Park.)

(Tohka and the others were recovered by the
Fraxinus, most likely for an examination. Kurumi
disappeared, and Origami returned to AST's base.)
(And so... I was left alone, crushed by despair.)

(That's right. In the end, Rinne had disappeared.
The ending I believed in never came. There was
no easy way out, no happy ending.)

(In the end, I didn't understand anything.
 Why she had created a barrier.
 And why she had tried to kill me.)
(It all ended, everything left in mystery.)
...Are you alright, Shin?
No, it's still getting to me.

Hm, I see. Then, perhaps I should find another
time to discuss today's occurrence with you?
...Have you learned something?!

That's right. Just now, when control of the
barrier left Ruler's hands... we were finally
able to analyze the barrier.

R-Really?! Please tell me!
What on earth was that barrier?!
Reine-san!

This may not necessarily be the best news
for you. Even so, do you wish to know?

(For a moment, I flinched at Reine's intimidating
words. But it's inevitable. If I can find out what
Rinne was thinking, or even get closer to her...)
Please, go ahead.

Mm. If you're prepared, then I will respect
your wishes.

Firstly, I will tell you that Ruler was an
existence similar yet different to a Spirit.
She wasn't... a Spirit?

No. However, I cannot say definitively that she
is an altogether different entity.

We won't know the details until we investigate
further, but... signs point to her being the
remnants of a powerful, spiritual energy.
What does that mean...?

It may be easier to understand if I said that
she has no vessel. Normally when Spirits are
sealed, the vessel remains. Ruler, however...
...would disappear, without a body.
Correct. It is unfortunate...

No, it's fine. Please continue. What about
the barrier?

(If I hear too much, I'd end up remembering
what just happened, and it'll be too painful.
I returned to the original topic.)

From our conclusions, the barrier covering all
of Tengu City, Eden, aside from keeping all of
us trapped, had another special power.
A special... power. Like everyone's Angels...?

Yes, something close to that. Although...
On a completely different scale.
Exactly what kind of power is in this barrier...?
Mm. Eden's power... is...
...the power to redo the world.
R-Redo the world...?
(What does that mean? It's a little tough to grasp...)

It's as I said. Existing within the barrier is a
power to restart the world as many times as
needed until a desired outcome is obtained.

That is Eden's power. You have fragments of
memories yourself, don't you?
Ah...
(Once she told me, I realized.)

(I... No. Not just me. Everyone else had
definitely remembered.)

I... remember. It's vague though. Memories
spent with Tohka and Origami... are there.
Could it be? Are they...?!

Yes. They most likely happened. Possibilities you
chose, inside of Eden's iterations. Endings that
could have been, born of the world repeating.

(All of that. Are you telling me it actually
happened? The memories feel too vivid to be
dreams or delusions. They definitely exist.)

(But... there's still one thing that I don't
know. I understand that the barrier holds
unbelievable power, but...)

Ruler... Rinne, what was her reason for
creating the barrier?
That is...

From here on, I am offering only suppositions.
Please understand that this answer is not an
absolute truth.
R...Right.
Restarting the world, with a caveat.
A caveat? What was it?

The current version of the world suddenly ends and
reverts to its original state. Several patterns
emerged, but we found one absolute condition.

In short, when a "certain something" occurs,
the world rewinds to its original state.
A... certain something? What is that...?
(Why is... my heart pounding so fast?)
Yes. The condition to restart the world... is...
Shin. It would be... your death.
What...?
(Death...? Did she say... my death?)

(I don't understand. What is Reine-san saying?
After all, I...)
Oh...

(That's right. That time, and that time, and the
other times... Having lost Kotori's healing power,
there were a few times I ended up... dead.)

(I... had been redoing it, over and over again.
 Almost like repeatedly saving and loading,
over, and over!)
When I died, the world would... start over?

Yes. The moment you died, the world would return
to the day the barrier was created. Shin, you were
the key to this world.

P...Please wait a second! Me, the key... why the
heck would that be?!

First of all, Ruler—er, Rinne tried to kill me,
didn't she? Because of that, I lost the spiritual
energy sealed inside of me—

Incorrect. The premise was... incorrect, from
the beginning.
Incorrect? What... do you mean?

...Shin, do you remember Tohka losing control
a while ago?
Tohka... losing control?

Correct. Tohka had suddenly lost control of her
powers atop the school's rooftop. Do you not
remember?
(Losing control... on the rooftop?)

Wha?! That's right... When that happened, I
got caught up in the blast, and—!

...That's right. Most likely, Eden activated
around that time.
H-How do you know?

...It must have, otherwise you may have
ended up dead then.
E-Ended up dead?

Until recently, you were affected by poor
health, weren't you? Before Tohka and the
other Spirits lost control, that is.

Ah, yeah. I mostly can't feel it anymore now...
But when I was examined on the Fraxinus,
there weren't any abnormalities, right?

It's true that nothing looked wrong.
However, an abnormality was occurring.
Along with a threat we didn't know of.

Something even the Fraxinus didn't know...
What is that?

This is mere speculation, but rather than the
Spirits, it may have been you that was close to
losing control.
Huh...?

Since you met the Spirits, your day-to-day has
become arduous. Tension and stress caused by dates
with the Spirits. Risking your life in battle.

W-Wait just a second! What are you saying,
Reine-san? It's almost like you're saying—

―Yes. It's only a guess, but it's possible the
barrier wasn't the reason the spiritual energy
within your body returned to the Spirits.

There is a high probability that your sudden
illness combined with various other factors,
accidentally caused this irregularity.
Then, that means...

(The cause of the Spirit energy's return
wasn't the barrier...?)

(Rinne's barrier was created at the same time
as when Tohka lost control.)

(Eden's power was to restart the world, so...
my death is the catalyst for activating it.)
(The dots... were finally beginning to connect.)
C-Could it be...? R...Rinne...

Where the girl Rinne Sonogami appeared from,
or what sort of connection she has to you, I have
no idea. One thing for sure, however, is...

(The spiritual power sealed within me... All of
it returned to the Spirits. Of course, Kotori's
Flame of Regeneration as well.)

(Between how dangerous that was... the memory
of dying so many times, and the world restarting,
the proof is all there.)
Ah... Aahh...

(Rinne... Rinne wasn't the one causing the
Spirits to lose control...)

(She hadn't even been trapping us for any
selfish reason...!)
(She did it for my sake...!)

(All while she was chipping away at herself...
To save me from dying, having lost the Flame
of Regeneration, she was saving me!)
Ri...nne...

That's correct. Ruler, Rinne Sonogami, created
this world solely... in order to protect you.
Ahh... Ah, aaahhh...

I...I... knew... absolutely nothing...
And I... went and... to Rinne... I... I...!
Please, go no further than that, Shin.
...Reine...san...?

Of course, it doesn't matter if anyone despised or
pitied her. However, Shin. For you, only you. She
sacrificed her life to protect you. Never forget.

Please, Shin. Rinne Sonogami simply tried to save
you. If you wish to repay her, then... please.
Instead of regret or apologies, give thanks.
Y...Yes.

Mm, you seem all right. Then, I'll hand this
over to you.
Huh? This is...

When you were all escaping from Neo Tengu Tower,
it got mixed in somehow. There seems to be
something inside, but... any idea what it is?
(Even if you ask me, I don't have any...)
I'll take good care of it.

Reine-san, um, could you... give me some time
for a little bit?
...Hmm?

I understand. No need to explain. However,
Eden's barrier will soon disappear completely,
and the world will return to its original state.

If you have any unfinished business, do it
quickly. Then, let us meet again, Shin.
Yes, thank you.

In the end, Rinne and I shared one last date.
Even though it was only in my dreams.

The time we spent cannot be recovered.
Rinne, who was by my side, is no longer
here.

I opened the bag that Reine-san handed me.
As I had expected, there was a familiar key
inside.

That's right. This was proof that Rinne was
my "childhood friend". The look on Rinne's face
when I handed it to her. Surprised, but elated.

She was that panicked when she forgot it at
home, too...

Didn't you promise you'd take care of it, Rinne?
Then, take responsibility. Take it with you!

Otherwise, I'll end up realizing how I won't have
you to wake me in the morning, or ask me how your
food tastes, that I'll no longer see your smile!

Why... Why?! You said... You said we'd be
childhood friends forever... that you wanted
to be together!
RINNEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!
Thank you, Shido. The time I spent together\nwith you... was my only true happiness.

Okaaay! Homeroom is now over. Everyone,
please be careful heading home.
Hey Tohka, let's go home.
Yes!
I feel kind of under the weather...
Hm? Are you all right, Shido?

Ah... I might just have a cold. More importantly,
I'm glad you're fine, Tohka.
Apologies, Shido... I am glad you are all right.

No, don't worry for my sake. Luckily things have
calmed down properly.

(Tohka almost lost control of her powers on the
rooftop. However, perhaps because Tohka did well
to endure it, things didn't get out of control.)

(Even if she lost control, it was slight, and
Kotori said there wasn't any damage. We were
able to avoid the worst. What a relief...)
Hrm...

Come on, don't look so depressed. It's times
like these when you need to smile.
Y-Yes!
Right, just like that.
...Hey, Tohka?
Hm? What is the matter, Shido?
Doesn't... something feel weird?
Hm, what does? I am perfectly fine.

No no. Something about this view, the city...
Like something's missing... In fact, was it
always like this?

Well, hmm. For example, over there by the train
station, something apart from the Tengu Tower...
wasn't there a big building of some sort?
Hm, was there...?

I see. Maybe not. Sorry for asking such a strange
question. Well, whatever. Do you want to stop by
somewhere?
Really?!
Yeah. Anywhere you want.
I see! Then Shido, let's go!
Ah, hey! Wait up! Tohka?!

*sigh* Jeez, but, what is it? I feel like...
I'm forgetting one more very important thing.

Something really important to me...
Something I shouldn't forget...
Heeeey! Shido, hurry! Over here!
Ah, right! I'm going now!

(Well, it's probably fine if I don't think on it
too much.)

(I'm sure I'll remember eventually.
If it's something important to me, I'm sure...)

Everyone... has forgotten... No, it no longer
happened. I, the foreign object, have vanished
from this world, and normalcy has returned.
It was... It was best this way, right Shido?
You... are...
Good work. You fulfilled your role splendidly.
At last, sleep well...

[205: A Small Miracle] has been added to MEMORY.
A small miracle, which may have occurred...
